analyzed: kye ma'o khyim bdag /

analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni /

translated: “Householders, when you do not grasp at the aggregate of form,🔽you will not abide in the aggregate of form.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po mi len pa de na khyed rnams 'du byed kyi phung po @33b la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po mi len pa de na khyed rnams 'du byed kyi phung po @33b la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When you do not grasp at the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, or the aggregate of formation, you will not abide in the aggregate of formation.

original: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam rnam par shes pa'i phung po mi len pa de na khyed rnams rnam par shes pa'i phung po la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam rnam par shes pa'i phung po mi len pa de na khyed rnams rnam par shes pa'i phung po la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Householders, when you do not grasp at the aggregate of consciousness, you will not abide in the aggregate of consciousness.

original: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam sa'i khams mi len cing /
analyzed: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam sa'i khams mi len cing /
translated: “Householders, when you do not grasp at the earth element,

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams mi len pa de na khyed rnams nam mkha'i khams la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams mi len pa de na khyed rnams nam mkha'i khams la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: the water element, the fire element, the wind element, or the space element, you will not abide in the space element.

original: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam rnam par shes pa'i khams mi len pa de na khyed rnams rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam rnam par shes pa'i khams mi len pa de na khyed rnams rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Householders, when you do not appropriate the element of consciousness, then you do not stand in the element of consciousness.

original: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam 'jig rten 'di mi len cing /
analyzed: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam 'jig rten 'di mi len cing /
translated: “Householders, when you do not appropriate this world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol mi len pa de na khyed rnams 'jig rten thams cad la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol mi len pa de na khyed rnams 'jig rten thams cad la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and do not appropriate the other world, then you do not stand in any world at all.

original: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam chos thams cad mi len pa de na khyed rnams chos thams cad la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam chos thams cad mi len pa de na khyed rnams chos thams cad la mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Householders, when you do not appropriate any dharma at all, then you do not stand in any dharma at all.

original: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam chos thams cad la mi gnas pa de na khyed rnams mi 'byung mi 'jig go /
analyzed: khyim bdag khyed rnams nam chos thams cad la mi gnas pa de na khyed rnams mi 'byung mi 'jig go /
translated: “Householders, when you do not stand in any dharma at all, then you do not originate and do not perish.

original: khyed rnams nam mi 'byung mi 'jig pa de na khyed rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
analyzed: khyed rnams nam mi 'byung mi 'jig pa de na khyed rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
translated: “Householders, when you do not originate and do not perish, then you do not have birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain,🔽and despair.

original: 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su thar par 'gyur te /
translated: They will be completely free from all conflicts.

original: sdug bsngal las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bshad do //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don @34a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro // zhes bshad do // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don @34a *//
translated: They will be completely free from suffering.

original: de nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //🔽skye ba dang ni 'chi ba yis //
analyzed: de nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so // skye ba dang ni 'chi ba yis //
translated: Then the Bhagavān, in order to teach this very meaning in detail, at that time spoke these verses:🔽“The entire world is burning

original: 'jig rten 'di kun kun nas 'bar //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di kun kun nas 'bar //
translated: With birth and death.

original: byis pa skyabs med gtse ba ste //
analyzed: byis pa skyabs med gtse ba ste //
translated: The childish are unprotected and tormented,

original: de dag 'phags pa'i lam las nyams //🔽brgya lam 'jig rten snang mdzad pa //
analyzed: de dag 'phags pa'i lam las nyams // brgya lam 'jig rten snang mdzad pa //
translated: And they fall away from the noble path.🔽The Tathāgata, the illuminator of the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Will appear from time to time.🔽Do not waste this opportunity;

original: dal ba chud zos ma byed par; ;brtson 'grus brtan pa rtsom byos shig /
analyzed: dal ba chud zos ma byed par; ;brtson 'grus brtan pa rtsom byos shig /
translated: Begin to practice firm diligence.

original: gang la gnas te rnam sgom pa //🔽shes rab kyis ni de yang ltos //
analyzed: gang la gnas te rnam sgom pa // shes rab kyis ni de yang ltos //
translated: Whatever you abide in and cultivate,🔽Observe it with wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis ni de mthong ste //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni de mthong ste //
translated: Wisdom sees it,🔽And it does not change into something else.

original: rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ro; ;gang la gnas te sems sgom pa //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ro; ;gang la gnas te sems sgom pa //
translated: Whatever you abide in and cultivate the mind,

original: thams cad stong par shes par bya //
analyzed: thams cad stong par shes par bya //
translated: Know that everything is empty.

original: chos rnams stong par rig nas ni //
analyzed: chos rnams stong par rig nas ni //
translated: Having understood that phenomena are empty,

original: byang chub nyid kyang stong pa nyid //
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang stong pa nyid //
translated: enlightenment itself is emptiness.🔽Desire, anger, and likewise delusion—

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang de bzhin gti mug dang // me gsum de dag shin tu mi bzad pa //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang de bzhin gti mug dang // me gsum de dag shin tu mi bzad pa //
translated: these three fires are extremely unbearable.

original: des na 'jig rten 'di kun rab 'bar yang //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten 'di kun rab 'bar yang //
translated: Therefore, this entire world is burning,

original: byis pa rig nas gnyid log khong mi chud //
analyzed: byis pa rig nas gnyid log khong mi chud //
translated: but the childish, being ignorant, do not realize it.🔽Birth, aging, sickness, death,

original: skye dang rga dang na dang 'chi ba dang // smre sngags 'don cing sdug bsngal yid mi bdes //
analyzed: skye dang rga dang na dang 'chi ba dang // smre sngags 'don cing sdug bsngal yid mi bdes //
translated: lamentation, suffering, mental anguish,

original: 'jig rten 'di dag gtses par rig nas ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag gtses par rig nas ni //
translated: and distress—having understood that these afflict the world,

original: chos rnams kun la gnas par ma byed cig /
analyzed: chos rnams kun la gnas par ma byed cig /
translated: do not dwell in any phenomena.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la khyim bdag lnga brgya tsam po de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la khyim bdag lnga brgya tsam po de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then those five hundred householders said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag cag rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das las rab tu byung ba rnyed par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das las rab tu byung ba rnyed par gyur cig /
translated: may we obtain going forth from the Blessed One.

original: bdag @34b cag rnams kyis bde bar gshegs pa las bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po rnyed par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag @34b cag rnams kyis bde bar gshegs pa las bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po rnyed par gyur cig /
translated: May we obtain the state of a fully ordained monk and the state of a monk’s ordination from the Well-Gone One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag tshur shog ces gsungs pa dang / de nyid kyis tshe dang ldan pa de dag rab tu byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag tshur shog ces gsungs pa dang / de nyid kyis tshe dang ldan pa de dag rab tu byung bar gyur te /
translated: By that very utterance, those venerable ones became renunciants,🔽were fully ordained, and became monks.🔽This is the way it is.

original: de nyid kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / de nyid kyis dge slong gi dngos por gyur to //🔽'di la chos nyid ni /🔽'di yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / de nyid kyis dge slong gi dngos por gyur to // 'di la chos nyid ni / 'di yin te /
translated: This is how it is.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //🔽de dag gis ni ngur smrig bgos //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya'o // de dag gis ni ngur smrig bgos //
translated: This is what is said about this.🔽They put on the saffron robes,

original: de dag gis ni skra yang bregs //
analyzed: de dag gis ni skra yang bregs //
translated: and they shaved off their hair and beards.

original: kun kyang lhung bzed thogs gyur nas //
analyzed: kun kyang lhung bzed thogs gyur nas //
translated: All of them took up their alms bowls

original: de nyid du ni dgra bcom gyur //
analyzed: de nyid du ni dgra bcom gyur //
translated: and became arhats right then and there.

original: ston pas dgra bcom rab mkhyen nas //
analyzed: ston pas dgra bcom rab mkhyen nas //
translated: The Teacher, knowing that they were arhats,🔽in the presence of the saṅgha of monks

original: dge slong gi ni dge 'dun dang // lha rnams mdun du mngon sum du //
analyzed: dge slong gi ni dge 'dun dang // lha rnams mdun du mngon sum du //
translated: and the gods,

original: ched du brjod pa ched du brjod //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa ched du brjod //
translated: proclaimed this proclamation:

original: 'jig rten gyi ni mgon po la //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni mgon po la //
translated: “The Lord of the World

original: sngon chad sbyin pa byin pas na //
analyzed: sngon chad sbyin pa byin pas na //
translated: has previously given gifts.

original: gang na bde ba mang ba der //
analyzed: gang na bde ba mang ba der //
translated: Wherever there is much happiness,

original: shin tu dga' zhing 'ongs par 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu dga' zhing 'ongs par 'gyur //
translated: he comes there with great joy.”

original: de dag gis ni nga mthong nas //
analyzed: de dag gis ni nga mthong nas //
translated: They saw me and

original: dad pa rab tu skyes par gyur //
analyzed: dad pa rab tu skyes par gyur //
translated: gave rise to faith.

original: de dag sems ni dang ba la //
analyzed: de dag sems ni dang ba la //
translated: To those with pure minds🔽I taught the supreme Dharma.

original: chos rnams kyi ni mchog bstan to; ;dgra bcom gyi ni gsung thos nas //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ni mchog bstan to; ;dgra bcom gyi ni gsung thos nas //
translated: Having heard the speech of the Arhat,

original: bdag tu lta ba rnam par bshig /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba rnam par bshig /
translated: The view of self was destroyed.

original: stong nyid mngon du byas na ni //
analyzed: stong nyid mngon du byas na ni //
translated: When emptiness is realized,

original: de dag skye pa kun las grol //
analyzed: de dag skye pa kun las grol //
translated: They are liberated from all births.

original: khyim bdag gi le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the first chapter, on the householder.

original: dang po'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lam gyi bar du khyim bdag lnga brgya tsam po mi g-yo ba'i gnas la bkod nas kun nas mdzes pas rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen por gshegs so //
analyzed: dang po'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lam gyi bar du khyim bdag lnga brgya tsam po mi g-yo ba'i gnas la bkod nas kun nas mdzes pas rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen por gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having established about five hundred householders on the immovable stage in the middle of the road, entered the great city of Rājagṛha, beautified on all sides.

original: @35a *// de nas rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer gyi lha rnams dang / gnod sbyin ci 'jigs 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: @35a *// de nas rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer gyi lha rnams dang / gnod sbyin ci 'jigs 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the gods of the city of Rājagṛha and the yakṣas of Aṭavika thought this:

original: bdag cag gis 'di lta bu'i sbyin gnas 'jig rten na shin tu dkon pa bcom ldan 'das la bsod snyoms dbul lo //
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di lta bu'i sbyin gnas 'jig rten na shin tu dkon pa bcom ldan 'das la bsod snyoms dbul lo //
translated: We will offer alms-food to the Blessed One, who is such a worthy recipient, so rare in the world.

original: snyam mo // de nas gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyis bsod snyoms kha dog phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: snyam mo // de nas gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyis bsod snyoms kha dog phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: Then the yakṣa Caṇḍa, having offered to the Bhagavān alms that were perfect in color,

original: dri phun sum tshogs pa; ro phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: dri phun sum tshogs pa; ro phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: perfect in smell, perfect in taste,

original: reg phun sum tshogs pa bcom ldan 'das la phul nas gnod sbyin ci 'jigs la thugs brtse ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bsod snyoms de bzhes so //
analyzed: reg phun sum tshogs pa bcom ldan 'das la phul nas gnod sbyin ci 'jigs la thugs brtse ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bsod snyoms de bzhes so //
translated: perfect in texture, the Bhagavān accepted the alms out of compassion for the yakṣa Caṇḍa.

original: bcom ldan 'das la gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyis bsod snyoms phul ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe steng gi bar snang las ci 'jigs kyi 'khor mang po gnod sbyin drug khri brgya stong gis legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyis bsod snyoms phul ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe steng gi bar snang las ci 'jigs kyi 'khor mang po gnod sbyin drug khri brgya stong gis legs so //
translated: As soon as the yakṣa Caṇḍa had offered the alms to the Bhagavān, at that time, from the sky above, the many retinues of Caṇḍa, six hundred thousand yakṣas, gave their approval,

original: zhes bya ba byin te rjes su yi rang ba'i sgra phyung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba byin te rjes su yi rang ba'i sgra phyung ngo //
translated: and they let loose a sound of rejoicing.

original: de nas de'i phyir gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyis rang gi 'khor rnams la bos te /
analyzed: de nas de'i phyir gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyis rang gi 'khor rnams la bos te /
translated: Then, for that reason, the yakṣa Caṇḍa addressed his retinue,

original: bdag gis ni /
analyzed: bdag gis ni /
translated: saying,

original: da gzod de bzhin gshegs pa la bsod snyoms phul gyi /
analyzed: da gzod de bzhin gshegs pa la bsod snyoms phul gyi /
translated: “I have just now offered alms to the Tathāgata.

original: khyed kyis ni /
analyzed: khyed kyis ni /
translated: You should also

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams la phul cig /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams la phul cig /
translated: “Give it to the community of monks.

original: de ni / khyed rnams kyi yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / khyed rnams kyi yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be for your long-term benefit, welfare, and happiness.”

original: gnod sbyin rnams kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun la bsod snyoms phul nas gnod sbyin de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang bsod @35b snyoms blangs so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun la bsod snyoms phul nas gnod sbyin de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang bsod @35b snyoms blangs so //
translated: The yakṣas offered alms to the community of monks, and out of compassion for those yakṣas, the community of monks accepted the alms.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen por gshegs pa las des bsod snyoms blangs par mkhyen nas sa phyogs de nas slar log go /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen por gshegs pa las des bsod snyoms blangs par mkhyen nas sa phyogs de nas slar log go /
translated: Then the Blessed One left the great city of Rājagṛha, and when he knew that he had accepted the alms, he returned from that place.

original: de ltar de'i tshe lha stong phrag du ma dang / klu stong phrag du ma dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po stong phrag du ma dang /
analyzed: de ltar de'i tshe lha stong phrag du ma dang / klu stong phrag du ma dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po stong phrag du ma dang /
translated: At that time, many thousands of gods, many thousands of nāgas, many thousands of yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: mi dang mi ma yin pa stong phrag du ma dang / srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma rnams bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i zham 'bring du dong ngo //
analyzed: mi dang mi ma yin pa stong phrag du ma dang / srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma rnams bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i zham 'bring du dong ngo //
translated: Many thousands of humans and non-humans, and many hundreds of thousands of millions of living beings, followed the Blessed One as he went.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sa phyogs yangs shing rgya che ba zhig tu gshegs te byon nas gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sa phyogs yangs shing rgya che ba zhig tu gshegs te byon nas gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One went to a place that was spacious and open, and sat down on the seat that had been prepared for him.

original: de nas gnod sbyin ci 'jigs 'khor dang bcas pas lha'i me tog mand'a ra ba dang / autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma blangs te bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la gtor /🔽mngon par gtor /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin ci 'jigs 'khor dang bcas pas lha'i me tog mand'a ra ba dang / autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma blangs te bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la gtor / mngon par gtor /
translated: Then the yakṣa Jṛbhaka, together with his retinue, took divine mandārava flowers, and blue, red, and white lotus flowers, and divine sandalwood powder, and scattered them over the Blessed One in worship.🔽They scattered them,

original: mngon par rab tu gtor ro //
analyzed: mngon par rab tu gtor ro //
translated: they scattered them again,

original: gtor / mngon par gtor /
analyzed: gtor / mngon par gtor /
translated: they scattered them, they scattered them again,🔽and they scattered them yet again.

original: mngon par rab tu gtor nas thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: mngon par rab tu gtor nas thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: Then, with palms joined, they bowed to the Blessed One and sat before him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyi bsam pa yang mkhyen /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin ci 'jigs kyi bsam pa yang mkhyen /
translated: Then the Blessed One knew the thoughts of the yakṣa Caṇḍa,

original: de'i 'khor gnod sbyin mang po'i bsam pa yang mkhyen nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //🔽chos nyid ni /
analyzed: de'i 'khor gnod sbyin mang po'i bsam pa yang mkhyen nas 'dzum pa mdzad do // chos nyid ni /
translated: and he also knew the thoughts of the many yakṣas in his retinue, and so he smiled.

original: 'di yin te /🔽nam sangs @36a *//
analyzed: 'di yin te / nam sangs @36a *//
translated: This is the nature of things:🔽When the blessed buddhas smile,

original: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'dzum pa mdzad pa de na zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog du ma kha dog sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'dzum pa mdzad pa de na zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog du ma kha dog sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: rays of many different colors emerge from their mouths, such as

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu byung ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu byung ste /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, crystal, and silver.

original: des 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa snang bas khyab par byas nas nyi ma dang / zla ba'i gzi brjid med par byas te sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par 'phags te slar log nas bcom ldan 'das la lan bdun bskor ba byas te kha cig ni /
analyzed: des 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa snang bas khyab par byas nas nyi ma dang / zla ba'i gzi brjid med par byas te sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par 'phags te slar log nas bcom ldan 'das la lan bdun bskor ba byas te kha cig ni /
translated: It illuminated the infinite, limitless world systems, outshining the sun and moon, rising above the hells up to the Brahma world. It then returned and circled the Blessed One seven times,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub bo //🔽kha cig ni /
